title: Which one is correct, 'in the process' or 'during the process'? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is difficult to answer this clearly without an example of how you wish to use it. “In the process” has two main meanings: 1. The state of currently doing (an action): We are currently in the process of shopping for a new car. 2. Something happening during the process of something else (less common than 1): Training for the marathon was intense; I twisted my ankle in the process. The first of these is the more commonly used in everyday writing and speaking. “During the process” is not a phrase on its own but could be used to mean “while a process is occurring.” Oxygen is created during the process of photosynthesis. You are more likely to see this usage in academic or instructional writing.

It depends upon the context whether you use in or during . If something happens because of the chosen process , we say ‘in ‘ e. g .:In the process of buying their votes the party had to abandon their principles. If something happens while the process is going on we say ‘during’ e.g.: During the process of spray-painting , dust particles , brought in by a strong wind , got deposited on the surface of the wall .
